name: Miami International Airport Hotel

reviews.text: If like us, you need a easy, clean place to stay after a long flight into Miami, Then choose somewhere else.
reviews.title: Very Poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is outdated and not very clean. The staff look like they have not had a day off for a year or more, so first impressions, not good.
reviews.title: Less than adequate. Take a shuttle to another hotel.

reviews.text: We had booked direct online and were told that breakfast was included. Surprise surprise in the morning " sorry your not down for breakfast, as we upgraded your room" If my room was an upgrade then heaven help the people who got our original room. "But we did not ask for one" no answer, The end result being that we had to walk around the airport at 6.30 am looking for breakfast, brilliant. As for the staff looking into it to resolve the problem, dream on.
reviews.title: Great for a stop-over/day room

reviews.text: Unless you have no choice stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Expected more.. delivered less

reviews.text: We stayed here as we arrived late in Miami and needed to be up early to catch a flight. I am not sure they really cared if we stayed or not. The check in line was very long with one person working who kept disappearing. I saw another staff member in the lobby and asked if he could find someone to help with the check in process. He informed me he was on break. He did go to help shortly after that. Okay...the rooms...filthy, filthy and filthy. Hair in the bathroom and bed. Had we not been so exhausted...well, you get it.
reviews.title: Odd little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a property in desperate need of a renovation. The rooms are dated and the place has a smoke odor to it. The walls are paper thin and the couple in the next room were certainly enjoying their vacation. How can you have soundproofing for jets yet a sneeze two rooms away can be heard? Room was cramped.
reviews.title: Go Off Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They toss in a breakfast for a select menu that is really just about nothing.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was pleasant and check-in was quick. I guess the only selling point is it is in the airport but save some money and take a shuttle to one of the hotels outside the airport.
reviews.title: Nightmare

reviews.text: What a situation !! Right on concourse E of Miami airport close to arrivals. Can't fail really to attract passengers either having come or going . Nice reception and ground floor bar. Ok the rooms are small but they do exactly as they promise with all necessary facilities. Views from 7th floor restaurant which again did all that was needed. The hotel reflects Miami Airport -- absolutely average but it does all that is needed albeit in not an attractive way.
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were arriving on a late night flight and had to leave out early the next day so even though we knew it was overpriced, we thought the convenience would be worth it. However, when we got to our room around 2 a.m. the airconditioning didn't work and they had to come move us to another room. They came pretty quickly and moved us to a different room, but it was TINY, much smaller than the one we had been in, and the shower didn't work hardly at all. There was barely enough room for two people and our luggage. I've seen closets that were way bigger. There was no window and the bed was not comfortable, but at least the a/c worked this time and we were too tired to argue for a bigger room like the one we had. The carpet in the halls is dirty. Also they didn't want to give us a key to our 'new' room even though we had to give the other keys back. The man that came to let us in the new room didn't bring us keys and when we asked for them he told us we could just go to the front desk in the morning to get one. Really? They sent an email after our stay and asked how it was. I responded and told them and they told me they had no record of our stay there. However, they certainly did charge our credit card. I sent them all the info including the credit card info and NEVER heard back from them. No customer service at all and it's overpriced and they charge for internet on top of that. I believe we would have been better served to wait for a shuttle and go to a nearby hotel for a better night's rest.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very old and shabby without amenities. The tiny window in the room was masked by wall to wall draperies. The bed was very hard and uncomfortable. They touted a free breakfast but the food was poorly prepared, dried out eggs and potatoes. To the embarrassment of the waiter the manager told him "they have to pay for a second glass", after the manager overheard me asking for another glass of OJ. The charge was $5.00. This after having paid $200/night for a a very mediocre room. When I questioned the manager he stated "we have to draw the line". So do we, by never staying in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Better to shuttle to a nearby hotel than stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here on several occasions over the past 16 years when we have unfortunately had to transit through the unfriendly Miami airport!!
reviews.title: Sleepless in Miami.....

reviews.text: If we have sufficient time we prefer to stay off the airport property.
reviews.title: what a rotten room for so much money

reviews.text: We had a King room it was so small, shabby, freezing cold even with fan switched off there was cold air blasting through vents & holes in the ceiling.
reviews.title: Great Location - THAT'S IT!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was so tiny the door wouldn't shut with the toilet seat down!!
reviews.title: REALLY COMFORTABLE BED & VERY CONVENIENT

reviews.text: I was going to give 3 stars before sleep, and went down to 2.
reviews.title: Odd service things that bug

reviews.text: Not hotels fault, but the layout of the terminal is kahrazy. So I finally find check in, tripple checking Im in the right space - I am. Wait 15 minutes in line for check in. Go through this weird decor of reflective polished steel, find my door - and I already know what to expect inside. It is old. It's used alot for its location and the owner has taken some repairs. Except, whoever they hired didn't do a great job. I could see all the Spackle marks, the shower/bathroom needs total renovation. When it tells you in the add that you get a spa like bathroom, you can ask them to take down that poster (2nd floor).
reviews.title: Best nights sleep of trip

reviews.text: And yes, you expect an airport hotel to have some noise. But come on, its called insulation. I heard all pm takeoffs. I heard a mom give a bath to her child in the neighboring room. And they were giggling and loudly happy until I flushed my toilet. I think they heard it.
reviews.title: Does what you need

reviews.text: Scheduled wake up cal happened 10 minutes early. But that OK because my other neighbors alarm had me up at 5am. I thought, awe, they got an early flight, they better get up. But they aren't turning off the alarm. Guess what - an empty room next to me, with a 5am alarm that doesn't automatically shut off. When I was leaving around 6, it was still going off.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay there for convenience and bring earplugs and zzzquil. <sigh>
reviews.title: Great place for a stopover at MIA

description: Convenientely located inside the Miami International Airport, Concourse E (Departure Level). Features 259 sound-proof rooms, Top of the Port Restaurant open for Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner.Day Use Rooms subject to availability.
